rules: Rule1: Provided that the professor served on a committee at the university, if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association.
Rule2: Either the professor served on a committee at the university or the professor advised a PhD candidate.

Rule3: Either the professor collaborated with industry through a company, or under the condition that the professor advised a PhD candidate, if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association.
Rule4: If the professor consulted for a government agency, then the professor filed a patent for an invention.
Rule5: Either the professor consulted for a government agency or the professor testified before a congressional committee.
Rule6: Whenever the professor testified before a congressional committee, the professor did not collaborate with industry through a company.
Rule7: Either the professor wrote a textbook for a publisher or the professor wrote popular science for a magazine.
Rule8: Either the professor published a paper in a journal or the professor does not have tenure at the university.
Rule9: Under the condition that the professor wrote popular science for a magazine, the professor achieved academic recognition in a field.
Rule10: Provided that the professor faces plagiarism allegations from a committee, the professor is not under investigation for research misconduct.
Rule11: If the professor committed data fabrication in a study, then the professor did not publish a paper in a journal.
Rule12: Either the professor committed data fabrication in a study or the professor has an authorship dispute with a collaborator.

Rule13: Under the condition that the professor has an ethics violation before a board, if the professor has an authorship dispute with a collaborator, then the professor did not publish a paper in a journal.
Rule14: If the professor licensed technology to a corporation, then the professor commercialized research through a startup.
Rule15: Whenever the professor founded a company as an enterprise, the professor did not collaborate with industry through a company.
Rule16: If the professor secured a grant from a funding body, then the professor did not publish a paper in a journal.
Rule17: Either the professor maintains proper documentation for expenses or the professor did not misuse a grant according to an audit.
Rule18: Under the condition that the professor has student complaints with the administration, the professor did not receive a teaching evaluation from students.
Rule19: Provided that the professor used digital learning on a platform, then if the professor engaged in pedagogical innovation in methods, the professor made course improvement to the curriculum.

Rule20: Under the condition that the professor taught an online course for the university, then if the professor engaged in pedagogical innovation in methods, the professor made course improvement to the curriculum.
Rule21: If the professor developed educational software, then the professor used digital learning on a platform.
Rule22: Either the professor developed educational software or the professor created a MOOC on a platform.
Rule23: Under the condition that the professor created a MOOC on a platform, then the professor used a virtual lab with simulation.
Rule24: If the professor used a virtual lab with simulation, then the professor taught an online course for the university.
Rule25: Either the professor used active learning in the classroom or the professor assigned collaborative projects.
Rule26: Under the condition that the professor assigned collaborative projects, then if the professor taught a course to students, the professor achieved student learning outcomes.
Rule27: If the professor created interactive content with materials, then the professor used traditional lecture format.

Rule28: Either the professor invited guest lecturers to the course, or under the condition that the professor used multimedia resources as tools, then the professor created interactive content with materials.
Rule29: Either the professor gave a keynote at a conference or the professor achieved academic recognition in a field.
Rule30: Either the professor engaged in community engagement with partners or the professor led service learning projects.

Rule31: Under the condition that the professor led service learning projects, then if either the professor did not conduct field trips for students or if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association, then the professor provided hands-on experience in learning.

Rule32: If the professor conducted a research seminar in the department, then either the professor filed a patent for an invention or the professor did not collaborate with industry through a company.

Rule33: Under the condition that the professor led a journal club for a group, then either the professor filed a patent for an invention or the professor did not collaborate with industry through a company.
Rule34: Provided that the professor organized a graduate colloquium for students, then the professor conducted a research seminar in the department.
Rule35: Whenever the professor participated in an undergraduate symposium with participants, then the professor led a journal club for a group.
Rule36: If the professor presented at an international conference, then the professor organized a graduate colloquium for students.
Rule37: Under the condition that the professor attended a local workshop, then the professor participated in an undergraduate symposium with participants.
Rule38: Either the professor chaired a session at a conference or the professor did not give a keynote at a conference.
Rule39: Either the professor reviewed a paper for a journal, or under the condition that the professor organized a workshop for a society, then the professor did not chair a session at a conference.
Rule40: Either the professor taught a course to students or the professor achieved academic recognition in a field.

Rule41: Provided that it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor did not receive an award from an association.

Rule42: If it is not the case that if the professor wrote a textbook for a publisher then the professor gave a media interview for a network, then the professor is under investigation for research misconduct.

Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the professor wrote a textbook for a publisher then the professor gave a media interview for a network, then the professor faces plagiarism allegations from a committee.

Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that if the professor has a conflict of interest in disclosure then either the professor licensed technology to a corporation or the professor founded a company as an enterprise, then the professor misused a grant according to an audit.

Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the professor used a flipped classroom in a course or under the condition that the professor used active learning in the classroom, then if the professor taught a course to students, the professor achieved student learning outcomes, then the professor used multimedia resources as tools.

Rule46: Provided that it is not the case that either the professor used a flipped classroom in a course or under the condition that the professor used active learning in the classroom, then if the professor taught a course to students, the professor achieved student learning outcomes, then the professor did not use traditional lecture format.

Rule47: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the professor conducted field trips for students or if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association, then the professor did not provide hands-on experience in learning.

Rule48: If it is not the case that if the professor engaged in community engagement with partners then if either the professor did not conduct field trips for students or if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association, then the professor provided hands-on experience in learning, then the professor participated in civic education for a program.

Rule49: Provided that it is not the case that either the professor presented at an international conference or the professor attended a local workshop, then the professor collaborated in a research network.

Rule50: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association, then the professor received a teaching evaluation from students.

Rule51: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the professor developed curriculum for a program or the professor did not teach a course to students, then the professor received an award from an association, then the professor has student complaints with the administration, then the professor engaged in pedagogical innovation in methods.
Rule52: If the professor did not secure a grant from a funding body, then the professor failed promotion in the department.
Rule53: Under the condition that the professor did not achieve academic recognition in a field, then the professor has tenure at the university.

question: The professor achieved academic recognition in a field.
